title: Sales Associate/Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Minneapolis Community & Technical College (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was good. The supervisor asked multiple questions adn I think I did okay.  We were wearing masks still because of COVID and I brought my documents. They are opening the store again for students coming back in fall and need people to be prepared to follow instructions to do with COVID. It went well.
Interview Questions: They ask for my previous experience

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Minneapolis Community & Technical College
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 6 people (including students) asking questions one at a time.  I applied for the position and had a first interview.  I was asked back for a second interview with the hiring manager and the Dean of Students. I was called and offered the position by the Dean of Students.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you know about Minneapolis College and its student population

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Minneapolis Community & Technical College in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Not too bad. There were multiple people interviewing and they ask for hands on applications as well as situation questions. Referring to customer service experience and previous experience. I was happy to accept the position. The only thing that was hard were the scenario questions, so come prepared.

title: Student Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Minneapolis Community & Technical College (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was short and simple.  I had to call them a few times to get an interview at first. We set up an interview and they offered me the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: What do you want to work here.

title: Course Coordinator (Interim) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Minneapolis Community & Technical College (Rosemount, MN) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied through MN state website, email invitation to interview onsite. One hour panel interview with key team members, followed by a half hour interview with the Dean. This was a very positive experience; everyone was friendly and welcoming.  I did not receive an offer; however, I received a very positive letter (mailed) from the Dean, thanking me for my time and interest. I apply for A LOT of jobs; this feedback stands out.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Minneapolis Community & Technical College (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly straightforward, but it took long given the state system nature of the position and institution. It was also nice once arriving on campus because I immediately experienced the diversity and connection of personnel to the mission and vision of the College.
Interview Questions: What is your experience supporting and integrating with diverse individuals in the community?

title: Staff Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Minneapolis Community & Technical College
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone conversation, an in person interview with 3 people and then a second interview with a group of 6. The first interview consisted of pre-written questions, the second was more conversational. The application process was confusing and tedious, the whole process took a very long time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at MCTC?

title: Art Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Minneapolis Community & Technical College (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy-going simple interview. We went through my resume and outlined which of my proposals will be good to use in the classes I have to teach in MCTC

title: Customer Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Minneapolis Community & Technical College
Interview Descriptions: Long process for a low-level job.
Interview Questions: No questions stood out for me.

title: Work-Study Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Minneapolis Community & Technical College (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: They were quite easy going. Just basic on why you want this job, what you can bring, and then going over what they require of you. They are aware you're a student and are very nice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?
